llm.feedback: Your draft is on the right track but needs tightening to meet the Argos standards. 1) **Canonical naming** – use the exact handle names: spx, rps, ust10y, us_core_pce, dxy, etc. 2) **Explicit citations** – every quantitative claim must reference a source ID. 3) **Date‑specific catalysts** – add the exact dates: Marvell earnings (2025‑08‑29), Tesla lawsuit filing (2025‑08‑29), Fed’s September FOMC (2025‑09‑16‑17), tariff announcement (2025‑08‑13). 4) **Magnitude ranges** – state clear ranges (e.g., “1–2 % slide”, “10‑year yield above 4.30 %”). 5) **Avoid generic phrasing** – replace “could see” with “likely to see” where supported. 6) **Add invalidation signals** – e.g., “if core PCE falls below 2.5 % the pullback may be muted.” 7) **Keep it concise** – trim redundant sentences and focus on the 0–3‑week horizon.  Apply these edits and the piece will satisfy the acceptance gate.
